alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 7:59PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cherry, southeastern Hooker, northeastern McPherson, and Thomas Counties through 845 PM CDT/745 PM MDT/... At 759 PM CDT/659 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Seneca to 10 miles southwest of Thedford to 16 miles south of Mullen. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thedford, Highway 83 crossing The Dismal River, Natwick, Norway and Shimmons Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 197 and 223. Highway 97 between mile markers 42 and 49. Highway 83 between mile markers 132 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT/1000 PM MDT/ for north central and west central Nebraska.
